cleaned_text: This list was compiled by Community Health intern Emily Wood in 2019. If you have updates to this list please e-mail [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) In Alaska religious and medical exemptions for vaccines are permitted. Naturopaths in Alaska must be licensed to practice. It is undefined whether or not naturopaths in Alaska are able to administer vaccinations. [State of Alaska Child Care & School Immunization Requirements Packet (Preschool-12)](http://dhss.alaska.gov/dph/Epi/iz/Documents/factsheet/AlaskaSchoolandChildCareImmunizationsRequiremntsPacket.pdf) [State of Alaska Religious Exemption Form](http://www.smskodiak.org/wp-content/uploads/State-of-Alaska-Religious-Exemption-Form.pdf) [Immunization for Children Program](http://dhss.alaska.gov/dph/Epi/iz/Pages/default.aspx) In Arizona, children are allowed to be exempt from immunizations based on personal beliefs, medical reasons, and religious beliefs. Naturopaths are licensed and seen equal to MDs in Arizona. This allows them to fill out medical exemption forms as well as administer vaccines. Some school districts may require more vaccines than listed on the state-wide list, always double check with a child's school. [Grades K-12](https://azdhs.gov/documents/preparedness/epidemiology-disease-control/immunization/school-childcare/school-immunization-requirements.pdf) (Immunization Requirements) [ARIZONA SCHOOL IMMUNIZATION RECORD](https://azdhs.gov/documents/preparedness/epidemiology-disease-control/immunization/school-childcare/asir-109r.pdf) Exemption Form](https://azdhs.gov/documents/preparedness/epidemiology-disease-control/immunization/school-childcare/medical-exemption-form.pdf) [Immunization Religious Beliefs Exemption Form](https://azdhs.gov/documents/preparedness/epidemiology-disease-control/immunization/school-childcare/religious-belief-exemption.pdf) [Personal Beliefs Exemption Form Kindergarten - 12 Grade Only](https://azdhs.gov/documents/preparedness/epidemiology-disease-control/immunization/school-childcare/personal-belief-exemption.pdf) [Arizona Vaccines for Children (VFC) Program Operations Guide](https://azdhs.gov/documents/preparedness/epidemiology-disease-control/immunization/vaccines-for-children/exhibits/operations-guide.pdf) (Arizona's branch's guide of the nation wide Vaccines for Children Program) [State of Arizona Administrative Code. Title 9, Article 7.](https://apps.azsos.gov/public_services/Title_09/9-06.pdf) In California, naturopathic doctors (while under an MD) are allowed to write medical exemptions for school aged children. Interestingly while MDs also write medical exemptions, neither MDs nor NDs get the final say. In California, MDs as well as NDs are now only allowed to write five exemptions per year without being investigated, however they are often rejected. Depending on the county one lives in, a child may require different immunizations other than some state wide ones. Check with your county's health department to learn exactly which immunizations a child needs. Children in California are not allowed to enroll in school without being immunized and the corresponding documentation. [CA Code of Regulations](http://eziz.org/assets/docs/IMM-1080.pdf) (Immunizations needed for each grade/age, also touches on conditional [CALIFORNIA SCHOOL Care/Preschool Immunization Requirements](https://www.shotsforschool.org/child-care/) [Preteen/Adolescent Immunization [Homeless Education Specialized Programs (CA Dept of Education)](https://www.cde.ca.gov/sp/hs/index.asp) (speaks on immunizations for homeless children as well as enrollment in schools) The state of Colorado accepts medical, religious, or personal belief exemptions. In Colorado Naturopaths are registered, but not licensed. Naturopaths are prohibited from treating children eight years old or younger unless they: have written permission from a collaborative physician, present the most current immunization schedule recommended by the CDC to the parent/guardian. It is not specified whether or not Naturopaths may administer immunizations in Colorado. [2020 Combined Immunization Schedule for Persons Aged 0 through 6 years](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/parents/downloads/parent-ver-sch-0-6yrs.pdf) [Adolescent Immunization Schedule Ages 7-18 Years](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/schedules/easy-to-read/adolescent-easyread.html#table-teen) (link to chart, scroll down to see) [Certificate_of_Immunization.pdf](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1vQwP2sOF_4javJNM0LHydbjZZA9HtOeB/view) Religious as well as medical exemptions are permitted in Connecticut. Naturopaths are licensed physicians in this state. It is unspecified whether or not naturopathic doctors are able to administer vaccines in the state of Connecticut. To receive a history of immunizations form, you must ask your medical provider. [Connecticut Department of Public Health Medical Exemption Certification Statement](https://portal.ct.gov/-/media/Departments-and-Agencies/DPH/dph/infectious_diseases/medical_exemptions/medexemptcertformrevApril2011pdf.pdf?la=en) [State of Connecticut Department of Public Health Religious Exemption Statement](https://portal.ct.gov/-/media/Departments-and-Agencies/DPH/dph/infectious_diseases/immunization/laws/ReligiousExemptionFormJuly2015pdf.pdf?la=en) [STATE OF CONNECTICUT IMMUNIZATION REQUIREMENTS K-12](https://portal.ct.gov/-/media/SDE/School-Nursing/Forms/Immunization_Requirements.pdf) [Immunization Laws and Regulations](https://portal.ct.gov/DPH/Immunizations/Immunization--Laws-and-Regulations) [THE CONNECTICUT VACCINE PROGRAM](https://www.cga.ct.gov/2012/rpt/2012-R-0514.htm) Medical and religious exemptions are permitted in the District of Columbia. Naturopaths are licensed here, however it is undefined whether or not they are permitted to administer vaccines. [DC Universal Health/Immunization Certificate](https://dcps.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/dcps/publication/attachments/DOH%20Universal%20Health%20Certificate_2019_0.pdf) [District of Columbia Immunization Requirements Age 2 - Grade 12](https://dcps.dc.gov/sites/default/files/dc/sites/dcps/publication/attachments/Combined%20Medical%20Forms%20SY%2018-19.pdf) In Hawaii, religious as well as medical exemptions are permitted if adequate documentation is present. It is undefined whether or not naturopaths can administer vaccines, but Hawaiian naturopaths are licensed. Medical exemptions must be requested and obtained through medical providers. [2020-2021 School Health Requirements](https://health.hawaii.gov/docd/vaccines-immunizations/school-health-requirements/sy-20-21/) (Childcare/preschool-12th grade) [Religious Vaccination Exemption Naturopaths](https://cca.hawaii.gov/pvl/files/2013/08/har_88-c1.pdf) [Vaccines for Children (VFC) Program](https://health.hawaii.gov/docd/about-us/programs/vaccines-for-children/) Religious as well as medical exemptions are permitted in the state of Idaho. Naturopaths in Idaho are also licensed and able to practice. However, it is not specified whether or not ND's can administer vaccinations in the state of Idaho. [Preschool & Grades K-12](https://healthandwelfare.idaho.gov/Portals/0/Health/Idaho%20Immunizations/Schools/GuideSchoolImmunizationRequirements.pdf) (School Immunization Requirements) [Idaho School Immunization Exemption Form](https://healthandwelfare.idaho.gov/Portals/0/Health/Idaho%20Immunizations/Schools/schoolexempform2018.pdf) [ImmunizationRecordRequests](https://healthandwelfare.idaho.gov/Health/IdahoImmunizationProgram/IRIS/ImmunizationRecordRequests/tabid/3801/Default.aspx) (The Immunization Records can be requested online, no forms to be found). [Idaho Laws/Rules for Immunizations](https://adminrules.idaho.gov/rules/current/16/160215.pdf) In Maine no exemptions are allowed for religious or personal beliefs beginning on Sept. 1, 2021. Naturopaths in the state of Maine are licensed and able to administer vaccines as well as fill out medical exemptions. Immunization records and exemption forms must be requested through a medical provider (including NDs). [Immunization Requirements for K-12](https://www.maine.gov/dhhs/mecdc/infectious-disease/immunization/family/kindergarten-guidelines.html) [Childhood Immunizations | Child Health](https://mainehealth.org/healthy-communities/prevention-and-wellness/childhood-immunizations) (Link to Immunizations for Children Program) [Immunization Laws | Immunization Program | Division of Disease Surveillance | MeCDC](https://www.maine.gov/dhhs/mecdc/infectious-disease/immunization/family/rules.html) Medical and religious exemptions are permitted in Maryland. Naturopathic doctors in Maryland are licensed, however it is undefined whether or not they may administer vaccines. [Vaccine Requirements For K-12 and Preschool](https://phpa.health.maryland.gov/OIDEOR/IMMUN/Shared%20Documents/Min_Vacc_Req%2018_19_Final.pdf) [Maryland Immunization Certificate and Exemption Form](https://phpa.health.maryland.gov/OIDEOR/IMMUN/Shared%20Documents/MDH_896_form.pdf) Massachusetts allows for medical and religious exemptions from vaccines. You may find the religious exemption forms at the child's school. Medical exemption forms must be requested from medical providers (NDs included). As of February 2020, naturopaths are licensed in the state of Massachusetts but they are not allowed to administer vaccines. [Immunization Requirements for K-College](https://www.mass.gov/info-details/school-immunizations#school-and-camp-requirements-) (has links for K-College, summer camp requirements, and a new [as of 2020] meningococcal requirement) [General Law - Part I, Title XII, Chapter 76, Section 15](https://malegislature.gov/Laws/GeneralLaws/PartI/TitleXII/Chapter76/Section15) (Laws on immunizations) Personal belief and medical exemptions are permitted in Minnesota. Naturopaths of Minnesota are licensed, however it is undefined whether or not they are able to administer vaccines. [Get Your Non-Medical Exemption Form Notarized](https://www.health.state.mn.us/people/immunize/basics/notary.html) [Student Immunization and Exemption Form - Minnesota Dept. of Health](https://www.isd191.org/sites/default/files/studentimzfm.pdf) [Student Immunization Schedule from Birth to Age 16 - Minnesota Dept. of Health](https://www.isd191.org/sites/default/files/studentimzfm.pdf) [Free or Low-Cost Shots for Children](https://www.health.state.mn.us/people/immunize/basics/howpay.html) Naturopathic doctors in Montana are allowed to vaccinate children and fill out certificates of immunization. Naturopathic doctors are NOT allowed to fill out the medical exemption form, though the law/s that govern medical exemptions are not consistent in their exclusion of naturopathic doctors. [Montana Department of Public Health Immunizations/Vaccines Web Page](https://dphhs.mt.gov/publichealth/immunization) (almost all information can be found through links on this main site) [Montana Childcare Certificate of Immunization](https://dphhs.mt.gov/Portals/85/publichealth/documents/Immunization/2018revisedHES101.pdf) [Montana Conditional Immunizations for Preschool through 12th grade. ](https://dphhs.mt.gov/Portals/85/publichealth/documents/Immunization/School%20Vaccine%20Requirements%20August%202019.pdf) [Administrative Rules of Montana](http://www.mtrules.org/gateway/Subchapterhome.asp?scn=37.114.7) (This link shows the actual law that governs vaccinations in children in Montana.) [Information about the Vaccines For Children program, which serves Medicaid and Uninsured Montana Children.](http://www.mtrules.org/gateway/Subchapterhome.asp?scn=37.114.7) Naturopathic doctors are not licensed in the state of Nevada, therefore they are unable to administer vaccines nor fill out medical exemptions. Nevada allows for medical as well as religious exemptions. Religious Exemptions must be completed and turned in by the parent to the school. Medical Exemptions must be completed and turned in by a medical professional to the school. [Immunizations Required for Child Care](http://dpbh.nv.gov/uploadedFiles/dpbhnvgov/content/Programs/SIP/Docs/Tech%20Bull%20IZ%20requirments%201-30-18.pdf) [Immunizations Required for School](https://immunizenevada.org/sites/default/files/Meningitis/MCV4%20NEW%207th%20Grade%20Requirement%20TB_signed.pdf) [Nevada's Statewide Immunization Information System](https://izrecord.nv.gov/public/Application/PublicPortal) (Keeps Record of all Immunizations) New Hampshire allows for religious and medical immunization exemptions. It is undefined whether or not Naturopaths can administer vaccines, however they are licensed practitioners. Immunization history must be requested from a healthcare provider. [New Hampshire Immunization Laws](http://www.gencourt.state.nh.us/rules/state_agencies/he-p300.html) [Certificate of Religious Exemption](https://www.dhhs.nh.gov/dphs/immunization/documents/exemption.pdf) [Immunization Children](https://www.dhhs.nh.gov/dphs/immunization/index.htm) [NH Requirements for All Ages](https://www.dhhs.nh.gov/dphs/immunization/documents/schools20-21.pdf) [Immunizations Tracking Tool for Birth-6 years old](https://www.dhhs.nh.gov/dphs/immunization/documents/imm-trackingtool.pdf) In New Mexico, religious as well as personal belief exemptions are permitted. Naturopaths are licensed and able to practice as primary care doctors in this state. It is unspecified whether or not naturopathic physicians are allowed to administer vaccines in New Mexico. [New Mexico Child Care - 12th Grade School Immunization Requirements](https://nmhealth.org/publication/view/policy/455/) [Religious/Medical Exemption Form ](https://nmhealth.org/publication/view/form/454/) [Laws for the Statewide Immunization Information System](http://164.64.110.134/parts/title07/07.005.0005.html) Naturopaths are licensed in the state of North Dakota. It is undefined whether or not Naturopaths are able to administer vaccines. Religious, personal belief, and medical exemptions are all allowed. [Certificate Of Immunization/Exemption Form](https://www.ndhealth.gov/Immunize/Documents/Providers/Forms/COI05-2012.pdf) [Birth - 5 Years Immunization Requirements](https://www.ndhealth.gov/Immunize/Documents/ChildCare/ChildcareRequirements.pdf) [K-12 Immunization Requirements](https://www.ndhealth.gov/Immunize/Documents/Schools/School%20Requirements%2019-20%20Final.pdf) Oregon allows naturopathic doctors to administer vaccines to children and write a doctor's note for medical exemption. Different immunizations are required for preschool and kindergarten depending on individual schools/early development centers. [Vaccines For Children Program](https://secure.sos.state.or.us/oard/displayDivisionRules.action%3bJSESSIONID_OARD=IilYPFDw0aIYkxDaIVRDrdySi2Ffu1V6TyYMsb99SIyP4w8KmpcJ%21-268141702?selectedDivision=1261) (For children under medicaid or those uninsured) [Immunization Requirements for Each Grade as of the School Year 2020-2021](https://www.oregon.gov/oha/PH/PREVENTIONWELLNESS/VACCINESIMMUNIZATION/GETTINGIMMUNIZED/Documents/SchBusEng20.pdf) [Oregon Health Authority : Exemptions and Immunity : Immunization Resources : State of Oregon](https://www.oregon.gov/oha/PH/PREVENTIONWELLNESS/VACCINESIMMUNIZATION/GETTINGIMMUNIZED/Pages/SchExemption.aspx) [Oregon Health Authority : Nonmedical Vaccine Exemptions : Immunization Resources : State of Oregon](https://www.oregon.gov/OHA/PH/PreventionWellness/VaccinesImmunization/GettingImmunized/Pages/non-medical-exemption.aspx) [School Immunization Rules](https://secure.sos.state.or.us/oard/displayDivisionRules.action%3bJSESSIONID_OARD=2rAGjMwAFKyKGiwIdp_03oUv7xaI6kjlhXdVWS78XLgPdYNa0jj7%21479495115?selectedDivision=1265) (laws) [State of Oregon Immunization Record Form](https://www.oregon.gov/oha/PH/PREVENTIONWELLNESS/VACCINESIMMUNIZATION/GETTINGIMMUNIZED/Documents/SchCISform.pdf) In the state of Pennsylvania religious, personal belief, and medical exemptions are permitted. Naturopaths are registered but not licensed in the state of Pennsylvania. It is undefined whether Naturopaths can administer vaccines or not. [Vaccination Requirements for Pennsylvania Schools K-12](https://www.health.pa.gov/topics/Documents/School%20Health/SIR8.pdf) [Birth to 15 months Vaccine Requirements Schedule](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/schedules/hcp/imz/child-adolescent.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fvaccines%2Fschedules%2Feasy-to-read%2Fchild.html) [7 to 18 Years Age Vaccine Requirement Schedule](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/schedules/easy-to-read/adolescent-easyread.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fvaccines%2Fschedules%2Feasy-to-read%2Fpreteen-teen.html) [Religious Vaccine Exemption Form](https://www.upsd.org/uploaded/Special_Ed/Religious_Exemption_Form.pdf) Naturopaths are not licensed in the state of Rhode Island, therefore naturopaths are unable to give vaccines. Religious and medical exemptions are both allowed in the state of Rhode Island. [Religious Immunization Exemption Certificate For Use in Public and Private Daycare, Preschool, School & College](https://health.ri.gov/forms/exemption/ReligiousImmunizationExemptionCertificateForSchools.pdf) [Medical Immunization Exemption Certificate For Use in Public and Private Daycare, Preschool, School & College](https://health.ri.gov/forms/exemption/MedicalImmunizationExemptionCertificateForSchools.pdf) [Immunization Information for Schools & Childcare Providers: Department of Health](https://health.ri.gov/immunization/for/schools/) In Utah, it is undefined whether or not naturopaths are able to administer vaccines, however they are licensed and recognized as physicians. Exemptions are allowed for personal, medical and religious reasons. [UTAH SCHOOL IMMUNIZATION RECORD](https://presidentscircle.childcare.utah.edu/_documents/immunization-pink-form.pdf) (form) [Utah Immunization Guidebook 2019 | 2020](https://immunize.utah.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Immunization_Guidebook.pdf) (More in-depth look at everything "vaccine" in Utah.) Naturopaths are licensed in the state of Vermont and as such are able to fill out vaccine exemptions as well as administer vaccines. Exemptions are allowed if they are religious and/or medical. [School Year 2019-20 Religious Immunization Exemption Child Care and Schools](https://www.healthvermont.gov/sites/default/files/documents/pdf/ID_IZ_CCP_Religious_Exemption.pdf) [Documentation of Varicella (Chickenpox) Disease](https://www.healthvermont.gov/sites/default/files/documents/2016/11/ID_IZ_CCP_Documentation_of_Varicella_Disease.pdf) [Vermont Recommended Child & Teen Vaccination Schedule](https://www.healthvermont.gov/sites/default/files/documents/pdf/ID_IZ_CCP_vt_schedule_kids.pdf) [Vaccines for 2 Months - 4 Years of Age ](https://www.healthvermont.gov/sites/default/files/documents/2016/11/ID_IZ_CCP_cc_imm_schedule.pdf) [Vermont Immunization Rules/Laws](https://www.healthvermont.gov/sites/default/files/documents/2016/12/REG_immunization.pdf) [Vermont Child Vaccine Program / Vermont Adult Vaccine Program](https://www.healthvermont.gov/immunizations-infectious-disease/immunization-health-care-professionals/vaccines-children-adults) In Wyoming Naturopaths are not licensed and as such they are unable to administer vaccines or fill out exemption waivers for vaccines. Wyoming has very strict rules about attending school without immunizations. A child cannot attend school or even day care for more than thirty days without immunization records presented. [Statutes & Rules](https://health.wyo.gov/publichealth/immunization/statutes_rules/) (Laws and rules for Wyoming immunizations.) [Requirements for Daycare as well as Preschool](https://health.wyo.gov/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/Are-your-Kids-Ready-for-Child-Care-or-Preschool.pdf) [Restriction of Use and Disclosures Request Form](https://health.wyo.gov/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/F-012-Use-or-Disclosure-Restriction.pdf) In Washington State Naturopaths are allowed to vaccinate children and fill out certificates of immunization. They are also allowed to fill out the medical exemption form. Washington allows for both medical and religious exemptions. [Immunization Laws and Rules - Child Care](https://www.doh.wa.gov/YouandYourFamily/Immunization/SchoolandChildCare/ChildCareImmunizationLaws) (Pretty much all info can be found here through links.) [Individual Vaccine Requirement Guidelines on Immunizations Required for Child Care/Preschool and School Entry in Washington](https://www.doh.wa.gov/Portals/1/Documents/Pubs/348-284-IndividualVaccineReqs2020-21.pdf) [Washington State Certificate of Immunization Status (CIS)](https://www.doh.wa.gov/Portals/1/Documents/Pubs/348-013_CertificateImmunizationStatusForm20-21.pdf) [Preschool and Kindergarten Immunization Requirements](https://www.doh.wa.gov/Portals/1/Documents/Pubs/348-425-ChildcareImmReqforParents2020-2021.pdf) [Certificate of Exemption Personal/Religious](https://www.doh.wa.gov/Portals/1/Documents/Pubs/348-106_CertificateofExemption.pdf) [Immunization Law and Rules - Schools :: Washington State Department of Health](https://www.doh.wa.gov/YouandYourFamily/Immunization/SchoolandChildCare/SchoolImmunizationLaws) (This link has all the links for each law depending on the age of the children.) [Patient Eligibility : Washington State Department of Health](https://www.doh.wa.gov/ForPublicHealthandHealthcareProviders/PublicHealthSystemResourcesandServices/Immunization/ChildhoodVaccineProgram/PatientEligibility) (This link holds information about vaccines for uninsured/medicaid children.)
